conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D, E, or F) the liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into after passing through baffles.

The first image shows three release points at the top labeled A, B, and C, colored rectangular baffles scattered throughout the board, and three collection points at the bottom labeled D, E, and F shaped like containers.
The release point A is orange, B is blue, and C is light blue/white.
Liquid from point A (orange) is released from the orange marker at the top.
In the second image, the orange liquid flows straight down.
The orange liquid hits the purple baffle at an angle and changes direction toward the green baffle.
After hitting the green baffle, the orange liquid continues downward.
In the third image, the orange liquid clearly travels to the left side of the board.
The orange liquid reaches the mint/teal baffle and continues to flow toward the left side.
The orange liquid from point A will flow into container D (the leftmost container).
Liquid from point B (blue) is released from the blue marker at the top.
In the second image, the blue liquid flows downward.
The blue liquid connects with the purple baffle.
The blue liquid appears to flow along with the orange liquid.
In the third image, the blue liquid appears to mix with the orange liquid.
The combined flow of blue and orange liquid continues toward the left side.
The blue liquid from point B will flow into container D (the leftmost container).
Liquid from point C (light blue/white) is released from the light blue/white marker at the top.
In the second image, the light blue/white liquid flows downward.
The light blue/white liquid passes to the right of the purple baffle.
The light blue/white liquid continues downward and encounters the brown baffle.
In the third image, the light blue/white stream creates a dotted pattern.
